text: in 96 i think when you were in your
early 50s your husband
um sadly and suddenly passed away
can you tell us a little bit about the
circumstances in which it was decided
uh you were going to be his successor
and i think maybe it was a little
unexpected both because you had no
training in engineering
and of course because of your gender
[Music]
third or second day after my first
husband passed away
uh the board met
and they decided that i should take over
maybe because the family owned 62
shares and all the executives
agreed because i felt
i think i'm not sure they felt they
could bully me and they could get their
way
not realizing how assertive i can be
when i want to be
and uh so it was the board's decision
to select me and all the executives were
very happy
but i wasn't i wasn't at all prepared
to assume this responsibility
i'm not only not an engineer but i'm
terrible at finance
so i have no interest so and i was
grieving
for my husband i wasn't ready to assume
this responsibility
uh talking about engineering my father
nor my husband
were engineers but ran very successful
engineering
company because one thing they could
depend on others you don't have to know
everything
and later on i also realized that you
could always take help from others
and you don't have to know everything in
fact
one of the beliefs i have is skills can
be
hired the leader has to show wisdom
that cannot be hired
you
